subject: Re: [junit] Testing philosophy question
msgSnippet: ... A test is an assertion that might fail independently of other assertions. If a group of assertions is needed to show that a behavior is correct, such
messageBody:
Chappell, Simon P wrote:

> <snip>
>
> >> Some people would put each assertion into a separate test method.
> >> This is a quasi-religious issue for some.
> >
> >For others, it is simply a way to count the number of tests accurately.
>
> Ok, so what is a test? Is a test an assertEquals() method call or is it
> a testXXX() method?

A test is an assertion that might fail independently of other assertions.

If a group of assertions is needed to show that a behavior is correct,
such making sure a stack actually tracks all its elements, then that is
one test.

<opinion>Most of the time, each assertion is a test.</opinion>
